name: overexpand
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to increase too much in size, number, or importance, or to make something increase too much in this way: If you hold your breath, air can trap in the lungs and the lungs will over-expand. Many tech companies overexpanded as home working increased, and will now face job losses. She overexpanded the company's operations in Germany.
More examplesFewer examplesUp to 5,000 full- and part-time jobs will go at the fast food company, which overexpanded in city centres.Care must be taken not to overexpand during the boom and find yourself seriously in debt afterwards.We will not over-expand the business over the next five years.
